summary: The K2 Veterans Total Coverage Act of 2025 aims to amend Title 38 of the United States Code. It establishes presumptions of service connection for veterans who suffered toxic exposure while serving at Karshi Khanabad Air Base (K2), Uzbekistan. The bill specifies a list of diseases, including various cancers, thyroid diseases, bone diseases, cardiovascular diseases, and others, for which veterans who served at K2 would be presumed to have contracted due to their service, facilitating their access to healthcare and benefits.
